nfcSupport.question: Does my device support NFC?
nfcSupport.answer: Most modern smartphones support NFC. On Android, you can check in Settings > Connected Devices. On iOS, iPhone 7 and newer models support NFC reading.

writeTag.question: How do I write to an NFC tag?
writeTag.answer: Writing to NFC tags is a premium feature. After upgrading, simply tap the write button, select your data type, enter the content, and hold your phone near the tag.

dataTypes.question: What types of data can I read/write?
dataTypes.answer: You can read and write various data types including text, URLs, phone numbers, email addresses, WiFi credentials, and contact information.

premium.question: What features are included in Premium?
premium.answer: Premium includes tag writing, password protection, data merging, advanced history management, and unlimited scan storage.

restore.question: How do I restore my Premium purchase?
restore.answer: Go to Settings > Restore Purchases. Make sure you're signed in with the same account used for the original purchase.

nfcNotWorking.title: NFC Not Working
nfcNotWorking.solution:
1. Ensure NFC is enabled in your device settings
2. Remove phone case if it's blocking the NFC antenna
3. Try positioning the tag at different spots on your phone

readError.title: Can't Read Tag
readError.solution:
1. Hold your phone steady near the tag
2. Make sure the tag isn't damaged
3. Try reading the tag with another NFC-enabled device

writeError.title: Write Failed
writeError.solution:
1. Check if the tag is writable and not locked
2. Ensure the tag has enough storage space
3. Keep your phone steady during writing
